subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text: Note the compositional differences between traditional, simplified, and Japanese shinjitai in the placement of the additional stroke.

subSections.title: Han character
subSections.text: {{Han char|rn=18|rad=刀|as=01|sn=3|four=17420|canj=SHI|ids=⿹刀丿(G),⿹刀丶(HTKV),⿻刀丶(J)}} <!-- G - China,; HTKV - Hong Kong,Taiwan, Korea,Vietnam; J - Japan -->

subSections.title: Definitions
subSections.text:
{{zh-hanzi}}

# [[blade]]; [[knife]] [[edge]]
# [[sword]]; [[knife]]
# {{†}} to [[kill]] with a sword or knife

subSections.text: {{zh-der|刃角|交光飛刃|兵不血刃|兵刃|兵無血刃|刀刃|刃兒|利刃|剚刃|劍刃|合刃|嬋娟刃|延頸待刃|張弓拔刃|手刃|推刃|游刃有餘|白刃|白刃戰|目牛游刃|芒刃|芙蓉刃|血刃|袖刃|赴火蹈刃|軍不血刃|迎刃而解|遊刃有餘|鋒刃|開刃|餘刃}}

subSections.title: Kanji
Readings
Compounds
Etymology 1
Derived terms
Etymology 2
Noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-noun|やいば}}

# a [[forged]] [[blade]], such as a [[sword]]
# the [[wavy]] [[pattern]] formed in the [[metal]] on the [[surface]] of a forged blade
# a [[sword]] or similar edged [[weapon]]
# something [[sharp]] like a [[sword]]
# someone or something [[powerful]]

Idioms
Etymology 3
Noun
Idioms
subSections.text:
* {{ja-r|刃に伏す|じん に ふす}}
* {{ja-r|刃を迎えて解く|じん を むかえて とく}}: “to fall before the blade” → a [[metaphor]] for [[extreme]] [[strength]] or [[power]]
